title: In-Gel Digest
author: Opentrons
description: Prepares proteins harbored inside gels for overnight protease digestion to produce peptides for downstream mass spectrometry analysis. This protocol is designed for SDS-reducing gels (PAGE). Through a series of steps, disulfide bridges between cysteines are reduced and the sulfur atoms are capped to prevent the reformation of the disulfide  bonds. The two wash steps thereafter removes staining as well as as excess DTT, acrylamide and ammonium bicarbonate, preparing the gels for the uptake of protease(s) in a pH 8 solution.  Protocol set for 20 samples.
process:
Add DTT.
Incubate for 30 minutes at 55C.
Remove DTT.
Add acrylamide.
Incubate for 30 minute at RT.
Remove acrylamide. 
Wash twice.
Dry gels.
Add Protease(s) of choice.
Transfer gels to 37C for overnight digestion.
preview: Explore the full In Gel Digest protocol used by the Stanford University Mass Spec Core.

markdown.title: In-Gel Digest
markdown.author: [Opentrons](https://opentrons.com/)
markdown.categories:
* Sample Prep
	* Mass Spec
* Proteins & Proteomics
	* Sample Prep
markdown.description: Prepares proteins harbored inside gels for overnight protease digestion to produce peptides for downstream mass spectrometry analysis. This protocol is designed for SDS-reducing gels (PAGE). Through a series of steps, disulfide bridges between cysteines are reduced and the sulfur atoms are capped to prevent the reformation of the disulfide  bonds. The two wash steps thereafter removes staining as well as as excess DTT, acrylamide and ammonium bicarbonate, preparing the gels for the uptake of protease(s) in a pH 8 solution.  Protocol set for 20 samples.
markdown.reagents:
* DTT
* Acrylamide
* Wash buffer
* Protease(s) of choice
markdown.process:
1. Add DTT.
2. Incubate for 30 minutes at 55C.
3. Remove DTT.
4. Add acrylamide.
5. Incubate for 30 minute at RT.
6. Remove acrylamide. 
7. Wash twice.
8. Dry gels.
9. Add Protease(s) of choice.
10. Transfer gels to 37C for overnight digestion.
